column4: please... This is rather important to me. If I cannot find another suitable way, can someone lend me 70MB on an ftp account please?
how about installing an FTP server, or rsync, or sshd, or anything which they can use to send it to you?
even 'nc -l' would do
what does nc -l do?
'nc -l' makes a listening 'nc'.  see 'man nc'
my brother wants to send me one of my grandfathers cds, but I don't know how to let him.
he's running Windows?
I don't have that much time. Do you know of a quich solution?
I don't know, why?
if you don't know what he's running, it's hard to tell you how he can transfer a file to you
how about getting him to email it in 4 parts or something?
it's sixty megabytes. But never mind. I'll ask him to ship it via snailmail.
that's why I suggested 4 parts.  20Mb is OK for a gmail attachment
so he has to send four mails, or can he make four attachements to one single mail?
I'm not sure.  but 4 mails is better - then if one fails, he only has to send that one again.
if he's on windows though, he probably won't know how to split it into 4 parts.
that's right. He doesn't, and I'm not able to explain it to him right now. :(
do you have a reference for lightning?
Lightning 0.3 is the latest release of our calendar extension for Mozilla Thunderbird
ie. lightning isn't a mail client, it's a calendar plugin for thunderbird
ok. I haven't really checked it out, because I'm very happy with Evolution. Thought maybe livingdaylight might like it though.
